com.yworks.yfiles.graph.styles

Class DefaultLabelStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.graph.styles.DefaultLabelStyle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILabelStyle, ICloneable, Cloneable

    public class DefaultLabelStyle
extends Object
implements ILabelStyle, Cloneable
    A basic label style which renders the label's Text and optionally a background and border.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DefaultLabelStyle()
      Creates a new instance using DefaultLabelStyleRenderer as renderer.
      DefaultLabelStyle(DefaultLabelStyleRenderer renderer)
      Creates a new instance using the provided renderer.

      • getFont

        public final Font getFont()
        Gets the typeface to use for the label.

        The default value is an instance of Font for Arial".

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - value cannot be null!
        Returns:
        The typeface.
        See Also:
        setFont(Font)

      • getFontSmoothingType

        public FontSmoothingType getFontSmoothingType()
        Returns the smoothing type for the Font that is used for the text.

        The default value is FontSmoothingType.GRAY

      • getInsets

        public InsetsD getInsets()
        Gets the insets for this label. The insets define the distance between the label border and the label content. The default value is an instance of InsetsD with uniform value 2.
        Returns:
        the InsetsD for this label.

      • getLineSpacing

        public double getLineSpacing()
        Returns the value for the lineSpacing property of the JavaFX text.

        The default value is 0.

      • getRenderer

        public final DefaultLabelStyleRenderer getRenderer()
        Description copied from interface: ILabelStyle
        Gets the renderer implementation that can be queried for implementations that provide details about the visual appearance and visual behavior for a given label and this style instance.

        The idiom for retrieving, e.g. an IVisualCreator implementation for a given style is:

        Specified by:
        getRenderer in interface ILabelStyle
        Returns:
        The Renderer.

      • isAutoFlippingEnabled

        public final boolean isAutoFlippingEnabled()
        Gets a value indicating whether the label should be flipped 180 degrees automatically, if it would be oriented downwards, otherwise.

        The default value is true.

        Returns:
        true if the label should be flipped automatically otherwise, false.
        See Also:
        setAutoFlippingEnabled(boolean)

      • isStrikethrough

        public boolean isStrikethrough()
        Indicates whether or not each line of text should have a line through it.

        The default value is false
